title: As a User, I want to view the Club Communication Dashboard
custom_preconds:
Wires:

BOC: https://zpl.io/an7kZpO

Club: https://zpl.io/VQdDy8W
custom_steps: WHEN clicking the Club Comm icon in the WBC Portal’s Left Nav
custom_expected: THEN the Club Communication Dashboard will load

title: As a User, I want to remove a player from a Game Report
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC or Fed Admin
AND viewing a game report
custom_steps: WHEN clicking the trashcan icon
custom_expected:
THEN a modal will launch

Title: Delete Player
Body: Are you sure you want to delete Last, First from this report?
Buttons: Delete Player(blue) Cancel(white)

AND clicking Delete Player will removed the player from the game report and throw a green confirmation “Player deleted”
AND clicking Cancel will dismiss the modal and the user will be returned to the report

title: As a User, I want to add a player to a Game Report
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC or Fed Admin
AND viewing a game report

Wire: https://zpl.io/br0XQPW
custom_steps: WHEN clicking the Add Plater button
custom_expected:
THEN the Add Player modal will launch
AND the modal will have a player dropdown
AND the dropdown will be populated with all the players on the Federation's Prospective Players list
AND once a Player has been selected, the Add Player button will become active
AND clicking the button will return the user to the Game Report where a new row will have been added for the selected player
AND all appropriate columns will be populated
AND there will also be a Cancel button on the modal
AND clicking Cancel will dismiss the modal

title: As a User, I want Game Reports to be automatically created for completed WBC Games
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is viewing the Club comms page

Wires: https://zpl.io/VQdDy8W
custom_expected: THEN new WBC games will create new rows on the Club Comm screens

title: As a User, I want to add a Non-Game Day Report
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC or Fed Admin
AND viewing the club comms page

Wires: https://zpl.io/2yG9o5o
custom_steps: WHEN clicking the "Add Non-Game Day"
custom_expected:
THEN the Add Non-Game Day modal will launch
AND there will be three fields on the modal:
- Date (Date Picker, required, default to today’s date)
- Type (Dropdown with ‘Workout’ and ‘Exhibition’ as options, required, default to blank)
- Federation (Dropdown with teams that the user has permissions to see)

AND when the required fields are entered, the ‘Add Non-Game Day’ button on the modal will become active
AND clicking the button will load a new report
AND if Exhibition was chose for type, there will be an “Exhibition Opponent” field on the report (This will be a required Free-Type)
AND the report will be populated with the federations full final roster
AND when the user returns to the Non-Game Day Report, three will be a row added for the newly created report
AND there will also be a Cancel button on the modal
AND clicking the Cancel will dismiss the modal and return the user to the dashboard

title: As a User, I want to view a Game Report
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is viewing a game report

Wires: 

Club Comm: https://zpl.io/VQdDy8W

Game Report: https://zpl.io/beOkn4P
custom_steps: WHEN clicking the date hyperlink
custom_expected: THEN the respective game report will load

title: As a User, I want to see if a Player's Report contains certain details while looking at the Game Report
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is viewing the Club Communication page


Game Report: https://zpl.io/beOkn4P
custom_steps: WHEN opening a report
custom_expected:
THEN The following three columns will appear on all Game Reports:=
- Box Score
- Comments
- Side Work
AND if a player’s player report for that game contains a Box Score (with stats) a check mark will appear in the Box Score column
AND if a player’s player report has text entered into any of the following Comments boxes, a check mark will appear in the Comments column:
- Offensive
- Defensive
- Results & Comments
AND if a player’s player report has any of the following side work boxes checked, a check mark will appear in the Side Work column:
- Weight Work
- Warm-Ups
- Conditioning
- Other Activities

title: Attempt to add an unsupported position to a game report
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in as BOC or Fed admin
custom_steps: WHEN adding a player to a game report with an unsupported position
custom_expected:
THEN a drop down will be displayed to update a players position
AND they will be added to the game report with the selected POS
BUT this should only set their Player type on the game report, not actually change their position on their profile.

title: As a BOC Admin User, I want to Publish a Game Report to Clubs
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in as BOC Admin
custom_steps: WHEN navigating to a submitted game report
custom_expected:
THEN a BOC Admin will be able to edit to make changes and save
AND there will be a Publish to Clubs button in the header when the report is in Submitted state
AND clicking the Publish to Clubs button will update the Report’s status to Published, trigger a green notification, “Published” and take the user back to the club comm page.

title: As a BOC Admin User, I want to return a submitted game report back to a Team Coordinator
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC Admin
AND viewing a submitted game report

Wire: https://zpl.io/2pjQEey
custom_steps: WHEN clicking the "Return to Fed" button
custom_expected:
THEN the Report will return to Preliminary state
AND the Team Coordinators will be able to edit the Report and resubmit

title: As a User, I want to submit a Game Report to BOC for Review
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as Fed Admin
AND viewing a preliminary game report
custom_steps: WHEN clicking the submit to BOC button
custom_expected:
THEN the system will perform a required field check 
AND if the check fails, the system will return a message notfiying the user what fields are missing
AND if the field missing is in a player report modal use the following format
Last, First - Field Name is required”

AND if the check passes, the status of the Game Report will be updated to Submitted and a green notification, “Submitted” will be triggered
AND the Game Report will appear on the BOC’s Club Comm screen with the updated status
AND Fed Admins will not be able to to edit Game Reports with a Status of Submitted

title: As an BOC Admin, I want to add a Non-Game Day Report
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in as BOC Admin
custom_steps:
WHEN navigating to the club comms page
AND clicking Add Non-Game Day
custom_expected:
THEN the Add Non-Game Day modal will launch
AND this will function the same as when Fed Admin adds this report

title: As a User, I want to view a DNP Player's Player Report
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is viewing the Club Communications page
custom_steps: WHEN launching a Player Report modal
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a position dropdown
AND the version of the player report displayed will be dictated by the position dropdown
AND Values include:
- SP
- RP
- C
- 1B
- 2B
- 3B
- SS
- LF
- CF
- RF
- INF
- OF
- UTL
- DH
- PH
- DNP

AND changing the position dropdown to DNP will load the DNP version of the player report modal
ANDc licking Save All will save and dismiss the modal
AND clicking Cancel All will discard changes and dismiss the modal
AND when the modal is saved with all required fields completed, the green checkmark will turn green

title: I always want to see a Next arrow on the Player Modals
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged into WBC
custom_steps: WHEN viewing a game report modal
custom_expected:
THEN every player report modal should have a previous and next arrow.
AND clicking the next arrow on the last player in the table will show the first player in the table
AND clicking previous on the first player in the table will show the last player in the table
AND this includes both WBC and ebis

title: As a User I want to know which number player I'm on when viewing a Player Info modal on a submitted or published report
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged into WBC
custom_steps: WHEN navigating to a game report
custom_expected:
THEN for reports with a status of submitted and published the word “complete” should not show beneath the numbers to the right of the modal
AND the numbers should reflect which player you’re viewing out of how many total players, instead of how many are complete.
AND as you click left and right the number should update
AND the green checkmark should still function the same, if BOC removes a required field the checkmark should still turn grey
AND the field MLB Player Info in the Status Info section should continue to show how many reports are complete.

title: Final Roster Position Rule Check
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in as BOC or Fed Admin
custom_steps: WHEN adding a player from the provisional to the final roster
custom_expected:
THEN Only allow supported positions to be added to each position slot
AND if the players position is set to a coaches position a modal will launch prompting the user to update their position
AND Don’t allow final roster players to have position changed (via profile or interest list)

UTL - Everything but pitcher
PH & DH - Only Infield and Outfield
OF, LF, RF, CF - Only outfield
IF, 1B, 2B, 3B, SS - Only infield
C - Only catcher
LHR, LHS, RHR, RHS - Only Pitcher

title: Export for PR Dept
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged into WBC
AND viewing the final roster
custom_steps: WHEEN clicking the Final Roster export button
custom_expected:
THEN an excel file will be downloaded
AND the excel export will have two tabs:
- Players
- Staff

AND the Players tab will contain the following information:
- Uniform Number
- Name (Last, First)
- Position
- Bats
- Throws
- Height (6-03)
- Weight
- DOB (1-Jan-97)
- Birthplace (Birth City, Birth State / Birth Country)
- Org
- Club

AND the Staff tab will contain the following information:
- Uniform Number
- Name (First, Last)
- Position
- Birthplace (Birth City, Birth State / Birth Country)
- Org
- Club

title: Can't download documents on chrome that contain a comma in the file name
custom_steps:
When a file is uploaded with a comma in the name users are unable to download it on Chrome. Everything is working as expected on Firefox and Safari.

Examples on dev
https://wbcdev.mlb.com/federationteam/42/player/profile/236?tab=0

https://wbcdev.mlb.com/federationteam/42/player/profile/230?tab=0

title: As a BOC Admin, I want to control the roster limits for a tournament so that rosters are abiding by the tournament rules.
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC Admin





Story
https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/WBCP-9

Design
https://zpl.io/aw6oonM
custom_steps: WHEN navigating to the settings page
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a section called "General Roster Settings"
AND the section will have an expand/collapse icon. Clicking should expand/collapse as appropriate.
AND the section should be expanded by default.
AND the section should contain the following setting.
-Interest List Max Players
-Default value is 50
-Only numerical values are allowed
AND when the form has changed, display an asterisk at the top of the page next to SETTINGS (https://zpl.io/brMkBAO) and activate the save and cancel buttons.
AND clicking save saves the settings and displays the green "saved" notification on the page (https://zpl.io/awJd8oM)
AND clicking cancel reverts the settings back to their previous values and makes the form "clean" again.

title: As a BOC Admin, I want to set the Final Roster Limits on the System Settings Page
custom_steps:
*Wireframe(s):*

System Settings: [https://zpl.io/aw6oonM|https://zpl.io/aw6oonM]

* In the Qualifying Tournament section on the System Settings Menu, the following fields will appear
** Final Roster Max (not editable) - Auto sums the following:
** Catchers
** Pitchers
** Infield
** Outfield
* The layout will match the provided wire
* Final Roster Max will auto sum the other fields
* Defaults will be as follows:
** Catchers: 2
** Pitchers: 13
** Infield: 7
** Outfield: 6

AC:

* There will be a position column on the Interest list as depicted by the wire
* It will be a dropdown populated with the same positions available on the player profile (provided data discovery)
* If the player is an ebis player, the position column will be pre-populated with the playerâ€™s ebis position
* Users may override position that comes from ebis
* Modifying the position will not send updates to ebis
* Changing Position will activate Save button
* Clicking Save will commit changes

title: Fed Admin should have access to all versions of a profile
custom_steps:
A Fed Admin should see a Federation Drop Down to toggle between multiple versions of that players profile.

They should only see the Federations they have access to.

An Example Player would be Robert Anderson on Andora, US, etc.  Fed Admin should not have access to his French, German, or Lithuanian profile.

title: As a User, I want Minimums for Catchers and Pitchers on Final Roster
custom_steps:
Wireframes:

Final Roster: [https://zpl.io/a3jxd0l|https://zpl.io/a3jxd0l]

Settings: [https://zpl.io/aw6oonM|https://zpl.io/aw6oonM]



AC:

* On the settings page, we will now show a Minimum box for Pitchers and Catchers on the Final Roster section
* The screen will clearly label minimums and maximums (similar to provisional roster limits)
* There will be red text on the final roster sections when minimums are not met (same way this is handled for staff)
* There will be additional rule checks upon finalizing the roster
** Number of Catchers are below the specified minimum
*** Error Message: â€œThe minimum requirement for Catchers has not been metâ€￾
** Number of Pitchers are below the specified minimum
*** Error Message: â€œThe minimum requirement for Pitchers has not been metâ€￾

title: As a BOC User, I want the Rule Checks to Fire when Finalizing the Roster
custom_steps:
AC:

* When the BOC Admin user finalizes a federations roster, rule checks will fire:
** All Players have PPA uploaded
*** Error Message: â€œAll players are required to have a PPA uploadedâ€￾
** All Staff have NPPA uploaded
*** Error Message: â€œAll staff are required to have a NPPA uploadedâ€￾
** Numbers of Players and Staff are above specified Minimums
*** Error Message: â€œThe minimum requirement for staff has not been metâ€￾
** All Pants, Hat, Jersey sizes must be input
*** Error Message: â€œPlayer and/or staff uniform sizes are missingâ€￾
** All Players and Staff must be assigned a number
*** Error Message: â€œPlayer and/or staff uniform numbers are missingâ€￾
* Any failed rule checks will be returned to the user
* The BOC Admin User will have the ability to override any failed rule checks and continue with finalizing the roster

title: Final Roster Rule Check
custom_steps: If a team coordinator is logged in when a BOC user finalizes the roster they're still able to make edits on the qualifying roster page.  A backend rule check should be created to prevent Team Coordinators from making edits to a finalized roster

title: Update Player eligibility
custom_steps:
If a player with an eligibility status of pending is removed from the the interest list that status should be removed. Currently if a pending player is removed from the interest list and added again their eligibility status is still "Pending" on their profile, interest list, and eligibility screen. Approved and Denied status should not be changed if the player is removed from the interest list.

To Reproduce:
1. Submit a player on the interest list for eligibility
2. Remove the player from the interest list
3. Add them to the interest list

Expected:
The player is no longer pending

Actual:
The player profile is still pending eligibility

title: As a user I want to be prevented from removing a player from the interest list if they're on the provisional
custom_steps:
AC:

* If a player is on the provisional roster disable the remove player link in the player options dropdown

title: As a User, I want to Export the Prospective Players List
custom_steps:
Wire: [https://zpl.io/aMpOK5o|https://zpl.io/aMpOK5o]

AC:

* When viewing the Prospective Players List, there will be an export icon, as depicted in the wire
* Clicking the icon will export the Prospective Players List to an Excel file
* The export will have the same population, columns, order, and formatting as the UI

title: As a BOC Admin User, I want to Finalize Qualifying Rosters
custom_steps:
Wire: [https://zpl.io/amWqYgm|https://zpl.io/amWqYgm]

h6. _Note: This story covers the section on the Qualifying Rosters tab and not the Rosters tab, as depicted in the wireframe. Both tabs will have the same sections._

AC:

* On the bottom of the Qualifying Roster tab, there will be a Finalize Roster button for the BOC Admin users
* Clicking the Finalize Roster button will prompt the user to confirm their decision:
** *Body:* Please confirm you want to finalize the roster for the following federation.
** *Buttons:* Finalize, Cancel
* Clicking Finalize will finalize the roster
* Clicking Cancel will dismiss the modal
* Finalized rosters will displayed â€˜Finalizedâ€™ along with the the timestamp and username of the finalizing user, as depicted
* Once the roster is finalized, Team Coordinators will not longer be able to make edits to the roster
* BOC Admins will retain the ability to edit the roster after it is finalized

title: As a BOC and Fed Admin I want to remove a player from the Interest List
custom_steps:
AC:

* Clicking on the remove player link in the player options dropdown will remove the player from the Interest List
* If the form isnâ€™t already dirty the Save and Cancel button will become active
* The Interest List count should update accordingly
* After saving, the add player icon should be enabled for that player on the Prospective Playerâ€™s list

title: As a user I only want to see the qualifying roster tab if that federation is in the qualifying tournament
custom_steps:
AC:

* Only federations that have been added to the qualifiers on the settings page will see the Qualifying Rosters tab
* Only federations that have been added to the main tournament on the settings page will see the Rosters tab 
* When a BOC Admin or Fed Admin switch between federations using the federation toggle they will remain on the same tab unless that tab is not visible for the club, then they will land on the Prospective Players tab.

title: As a user I want the add player icon greyed out if that player is already on the Interest List
custom_steps:
AC:

* On Prospective Players the add player icon is disabled if that player is on the Interest List

title: Denies Player Eligibility

AC:

* There will be a Deny button on every player with a Pending Status' row, as depicted in the wire
* Clicking Deny will display a modal, as depicted in the wire
* The modal will have a required Reason for â€œEligibility Denialâ€￾
* There will be an inactive Deny button on the modal
* There will be a Cancel button on the modal
** Clicking Cancel will dismiss the modal
* When comments have been entered in the comment box, the Deny button will become active
* Clicking Deny will update the playerâ€™s eligibility status to Denied
* The modal will close and there will be a green Denied confirmation message
* The player will remain on the Federationâ€™s Interest List with a Denied status and a comments bubble with the Reason for Eligibility Denial

As a WBC BOC Admin, I want Total Pitches removed from pitcher club comm reports

Wireframe: [https://zpl.io/bWmJZkM|https://zpl.io/bWmJZkM|smart-link]

AC:

* Total Pitches will no longer appear on game day reports
* Total Pitches will no longer appear on non-game day reports

* Player profiles display RHR/RHS/LHR/LHS as positions for pitchers.  On the game and non-game day reports, positions are only listed as SP and RP.

AC:

* When viewing a game day report or a non-game day report, the Pos column will match a playerâ€™s profile positions
** No SP or RP
* When viewing an individual playerâ€™s report, the Position dropdown will reflect the position dropdown on player profiles
** No SP or RP

* This field will be a text box

title: As a BOC Admin, I want certain player information to be updated from ebis daily
custom_steps:
AC:

* If a player is released, and is no longer affiliated, that will be reflected in the portal
** Org/Club will be updated
** Will no longer require Club Comm report
* If a player is signed, and is now considered an affiliated player, that will be reflected in the portal
** Org/Club will be updated
** Will now require Club Comm report
* If a player is added to the 40-man roster, that will be reflected in the portal
** 40-Man flag will be updated
* If a player is removed from the 40-man roster, that will be reflected in the portal
** 40-Man flag will be updated
* If a player is placed on the IL, that will be reflected in the portal
** IL flag will be updated
* If a player is reinstated from the IL, that will be reflected in the portal
** IL flag will be updated

These updates do not need to be real-time.  An overnight batch should work fine.

title: As an BOC Admin, I want to add a Non-Game Day Report
custom_steps:
BOC Club Comm Dash: [https://zpl.io/an7kZpO|https://zpl.io/an7kZpO]

Add Non-game Day: [https://zpl.io/2yG9o5o|https://zpl.io/2yG9o5o]

Data Discovery: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/23888074/Club+Communication+Dashboard|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/23888074/Club+Communication+Dashboard|smart-link] 

AC:

* When BOC Users are viewing the Club Comm Dashboard There will be an 'Add Non-Game Day' button on the Club Comm Dashboard
* Clicking the button will launch the Add Non-Game Day modal
* There will be three fields on the modal:
** Date
*** Date Picker, required, default to todayâ€™s date
** Type
*** Dropdown with â€˜Workoutâ€™ and â€˜Exhibitionâ€™ as options, required, default to blank
** Federation
*** Dropdown with teams that the user has permissions to see
* When the required fields are entered, the â€˜Add Non-Game Dayâ€™ button on the modal will become active
* Clicking the button will load a new report
* If Exhibition was chose for type, there will be an â€œExhibition Opponentâ€� field on the report
** This will be a required Free-Type
* The report will be populated with the federations full final roster
* There will also be a Cancel button on the modal
** Clicking the Cancel will dismiss the modal and return the user to the dashboard
* When the user returns to the Non-Game Day Report, there will be a row added for the newly created report
